Class Pixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pixel

  • public class Pixel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a pixel, which has a value for red, green, blue, and alpha (RGBA). Pics are made up of Pixels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pixel(int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Creates a pixel and, if the RGBA values are valid (they are between 0 and 255 inclusive), will initialize its RGBA vlaues.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAlpha()
      This method returns the pixel's alpha value.
      int getBlue()
      This method returns the pixel's blue value.
      int getGreen()
      This method returns the pixel's green value.
      int getRed()
      This method returns the pixel's red value.
      boolean isValidValue(int rgbaValue)
      Returns whether or not the user wants to set a pixel's RGBA to a valid number.
      void setAlpha(int newAlpha)
      This method sets the pixel's alpha value to the value of the argument, if it is valid.
      void setBlue(int newBlue)
      This method sets the pixel's blue value to the value of the argument, if it is valid.
      void setGreen(int newGreen)
      This method sets the pixel's green value to the value of the argument, if it is valid.
      void setRed(int newRed)
      This method sets the pixel's red value to the value of the argument, if it is valid.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pixel

        public Pixel(int red,
             int green,
             int blue,
             int alpha)
        Creates a pixel and, if the RGBA values are valid (they are between 0 and 255 inclusive), will initialize its RGBA vlaues.
        Parameters:
        red - the integer representing the Pixel's red value
        green - the integer representing the Pixel's green value
        blue - the integer representing the Pixel's blue value
        alpha - the integer representing the Pixel's alpha value

      • isValidValue

        public boolean isValidValue(int rgbaValue)
        Returns whether or not the user wants to set a pixel's RGBA to a valid number.
        Parameters:
        rgbaValue - the integer that the user plans to set one of the pixel's RGBA values to
        Returns:
        if the RGBA value is between 0 and 255 inclusive
